alert.note: Alert for Bear Lake Valley; Blackfoot Mountains; Caribou Range; Teton Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 27 at 2:49AM MST until December 27 at 9:00PM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches below 6000 feet and 4 to 9 inches across the mountains and passes above 6000 feet. Wind of 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 40 mph will cause heavy drifting of snow, and low visibility in blowing snow. * WHERE...Teton Valley south through the Caribou Mountains to Bear Lake Valley, including Georgetown Summit. * WHEN...Until 9 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel may remain difficult to impossible at times. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility and drifting snow create temporary road closures.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Bear Lake Valley; Blackfoot Mountains; Caribou Range; Teton Valley
